citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a perimeter fence around two outdoor skunk enclosures. The licensee currently has two skunk
enclosures under a three sided building that is open to a field on one side, but does not have a perimeter fence.
A perimeter fence is important to ensure that the skunks are protected from unauthorized humans and animals which may
intend to have contact with them and could cause harm.
Licensees are required to enclose outdoor housing facilities for skunks with a perimeter fence, not less than 6 feet high
and not less than 3 feet in distance from the primary enclosure. The fence must be constructed so that it protects the
animals by restricting unauthorized humans and animals from going through it or under it and having contact with the
animals in the facility, and so that it can function as a secondary containment system for the animals in the facility.
Correct by: May 1, 2026.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
The facility does not have a perimeter fence around two outdoor skunk enclosures. The licensee currently has two skunk 
enclosures under a three sided building that is open to a field on one side, but does not have a perimeter fence.  
A perimeter fence is important to ensure that the skunks are protected from unauthorized humans and animals which may 
intend to have contact with them and could cause harm.  
Licensees are required to enclose outdoor housing facilities for skunks with a perimeter fence, not less than 6 feet high 
and not less than 3 feet in distance from the primary enclosure. The fence must be constructed so that it protects the 
animals by restricting unauthorized humans and animals from going through it or under it and having contact with the 
animals in the facility, and so that it can function as a secondary containment system for the animals in the facility.  
Correct by: May 1, 2026. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
